result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark W Higgins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail credit to be determined at a later date if Defendant is revoked from probation.
Must meet with Probation within 14 days.

miscConds.notes:
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. 
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Restitution to be determined within 10 days and a hearing set within 60 days.
11/01/2022 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,433.31. $500.00 CASH BOND TO BE APPLIED TO RESTITUTION.

Must have no contact with the Barron County Humane Society or come within 300 feet of the facility. 
Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must not go anywhere alcohol is either sold or served for consumption on the premises. 
Must not possess, inject, inhale, ingest or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider and only taken in the amounts prescribed. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider and only taken in the amounts prescribed.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail within 72 hours to submit DNA sample.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit to be determined at a later date if the Defendant is revoked from probation.
Concurrent with: Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

Sentence credit will be determined at a later date if the Defendant is revoked from probation.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 and 2.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 and 2 together with conditions.

defendant.name: Higgins, Mark W

records.addlTxt: Restitution Order

3:37 PM Defendant Mark W Higgins in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Mark W Higgins.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin.  Probation agent Jessica Kunz appears in person.  
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights previously filed in August 2022 discussed.  State relates victim rights have been complied with and moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor Theft 943.20(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor. Court grants amendment.  Ms. Yonk and Ms. Fitzgerald, victims / representatives from the facility relate on restitution amount and they are to provide documentation to the District Attorney's office within 10 days.  Agent Kunz relates.


Count 1 - Guilty plea to amended charge.
Count 2 - Guilty plea entered.
Count 3 - Guilty plea entered.

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty. State relates.  Attorney Erdman relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

IMPOSED/STAYED SENTENCE
IMPOSED
9 months on each count - Concurrent with each other


STAYED
2 years Probation
Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must not go anywhere alcohol is either sold or served for consumption on the premises. 
Must not possess, inject, inhale, ingest or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider and only taken in the amounts prescribed. 
Must meet with Probation within 14 days.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider and only taken in the amounts prescribed. 
Restitution to be determined within 10 days and a hearing set within 60 days.
Must have no contact with the Barron county Humane Society or come within 300 feet of the facility.
Costs including DNA surcharge
Jail credit to be determined at a later date if Defendant is revoked from Probation.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court.  Must report to the Barron County Jail within 72 hours submit DNA sample.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark W Higgins

Prior: HOMELESS, Rice Lake, WI 54868

Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than one week in advance of jury trial.

Court accepts the waiver, finds probable cause, and binds over for trial. Speedy trial demand requested. Arraignment set. Defendant to appear by zoom. Bail continues.

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark W Higgins appeared by video, in custody.   Attorney Michael Steuer appears by zoom video for today only.
Attorney Steuer relates they have not found counsel yet.  10;16 a.m.  Attorney Steuer and Defendant put in a break-out room and case to be recalled.  10:24 a.m. case recalled.  Court relates AIA will be set before Judge Bitney.  Attorney Steuer relates Defendant makes a speedy trial demand.  Attorney Steuer relates Competency is not being addressed at this time, but may be later.


SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL

10:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark W Higgins appeared by video, in custody. 
Counsel has not yet been appointed for the Defendant. Attorney Steuer relates counsel is being sought. Defense makes request for bond modification from a cash bond to a signature bond. Attorney ADA O'Boyle relates. 
Court relates and denies the request for bond modification.
